title: Can we please get an explanation for why mages are getting nerfed so hard next season?
body:
I really am baffled for the decision behind this choice. Most staple AP items are going up in price for seemingly no adequate reason, while MR is getting cheaper and ADC items are being created to deal with Mages' burst damage (like Death's Dance) and CC (Merc Scimitar getting a buff) with reasonable prices attached to them (less costly builds on champs that are purposely fed/farm more than most other positions).

The decisions made, with no explanation for "why", really does get me confused. If we could only get an explanation, that would be lovely. It feels as if you are simply nerfing mages for the sake of change/allowing marksmen be more noticeably powerful compared to other champs for the "Marksman Update" coming in Season 6.

So please, anyone from Riot, an explanation for the reasoning behind these decisions would be lovely.

The price changes have to do with the changes to gold generation. I believe ambient gold (gold you make per second) was increased from 19 per 10 seconds to 20.4 per 10. I know that's what Riot said, but it doesn't make sense for a lot of reasons.  These are the two biggest from what I've seen.  

1}  If everyone's going to be getting more gold overall, then why does it seem like only AP items are having their prices increased?  Yes, a few AD items are going up, but those items are also getting buffed.  For the most part, AP items are having their cost increased while also getting nerfed.  

2}  Why bother giving us more gold overall if we need to spend more of it to get what we need?  This example is highly simplified, but it's basically what is happening.  
*<X item> currently costs 100 gold.  With the current system, a player averages 1 gold per second.  That means that after 100 seconds, they can get <X item>.  With the new system, <X item> costs 200 gold, but you get 2 gold per second.  You'll still be getting the same item at the same time, but you'll be spending more for it.  That doesn't matter though, since you'll be getting more gold to compensate for the price increase.*

ADC items, Tank items and Mage items have gone up in price.

The prices going up is compensating the face that Season 6 allows faster clears, The Rift Herald, Global gold and more gold from bounties, more passive gold generation, and the support items giving more gold.
Many adc items now have more utility but less stats, like - 15ad on IE and such. Not sure if the prices are right, but that might be why they seem off.

Part of the change to gold generation is to proportionally increase support income. With higher passive GP10 and slightly higher income from support items, they can close the income gap somewhat. 

If you look at the bigger picture, the combination of more starting gold, higher base stats, higher mana regen/mana pools, and stronger starting items will work to speed up games overall. Less passive farming with more kill/duel windows earlier in the game.

A super-simplified explanation to go along with your super-simplified example:
Because you might want to have an item in your current system that costs 55.5 gold, or an event that grants 1.5 gold, but don't want to implement fractional gold values.
In the new system, that item costs 111 gold, or that event grants 3 gold.
I know people like to say "it adds up," but that's 9 gold every minute, meaning 90g every 10. I don't think that's gonna change a whole lot. 270 or 360g in a 30 and 40 minute game respectively.

Buy banshees and don't be dumb. Stay with your teams CC. If you dont have any, GG.

Marksman, a role in which getting blown up without peel, but doing insane damage by autoing everyone to death if positioned properly is part of the job description.

Annie can get you if you are out of position/if you blindly check a bush. She is a burst mage, her job is to burst a target and slowly do some magic damage from the backline. If you are in front of your group/with people who cannot peel for you, then you're the one to blame if she blows you up.

Kat can't burst very hard compared to before and you can actually kick her ass if she either has not enough dmg to burst you from full to none/you have a support with CC/you have any sort of champ which can keep you alive through her burst (in which she has to get close enough to shunpo onto you to properly do the dmg).

Kassadin is good at assassinating, though the limited range on his R makes him have to surprise you to get all the way into your team's backline to kill you. Once again, if he doesn't have the dmg/you have CC he can be peeled off.

Leblanc is a great assassin, though to burst you from full she tends to need to use her full combo on you (which, yet again, if you are properly positioned, you shouldn't be too worried).

In essence, every single one of these champs have ways to be counterplayed, some of them straight up suck if they lose in the early game, and Marksmen should never be able to solo push a lane without any sort of champion beside them to keep them safe (unless they are VERY fed).

This update takes away the few weaknesses marksmen had by buffing them ludicrously + giving them amazing itemization choices against certain champs (RIP {{champion:50}}, {{champion:36}}, and {{champion:266}}). Most mages are balanced where they are right now and tend to be specialized to do certain jobs (usually providing a backup source of CC + a source of magic dmg). They really don't need to be nerfed as a whole (especially when marksmen, some of which are now designed for the midlane/toplane) are competing in the only place they are considered viable at the moment (mostly mid lane, but some top lane depending on meta shifts).

I could keep going, but Fusarix pretty much sums up what I want to say in his post. Play to your strengths, don't play to your weaknesses, buy certain items, and do what your champion excels at. Don't blame other champs if you can't play your role properly/play very unsafe.

If you group up, there are many champs that can fuck you up. It's called "AOE". Annie's not the only one with it; just don't group up in a bush when Annie is around/you have no vision. It practically can be attributed to "Don't be a noob. Play smart."

Leblanc's 2 dashes are pretty BS, IMO, but I personally just hate the champ. I am sure someone can make a good argument for her.

Xerath is long range, but 100% skillshots. That's his schtick. He's not problematic at the moment, so talking about him like he is will lead this conversation nowhere (in essence, if you are insinuating that Xerath is currently a problem, then you are wrong; plain and simple).

Right now, Mages are in a fine place. You realize that ADCs like Vayne can fuck them up in many situations as it is. Most of them have recieved massive nerfs over the years to achieve balance. Nerfing the itemization of them for no reason is.. well.. stupid; there's no reason (or at least Riot hasn't explained it).

It's not hard to make a good argument for Leblanc:

1) Her early game sucks rocks. She gets a decent power spike at 6, but before then, she's nasty mana hungry, is forced to level her W first because it's her only waveclear, and thus can't harass anyone unless they're stupid enough to stand in the low range of her W. After six, she gets enough assassination potential that she can potentially outplay, but if the opponent knows how to position, she won't be able to kill them, and then her power wanes again until 11. 
2) She is reliant on either skill shots or close range to kill. Her Q/ulted Q is devastating, but she can't actually kill unless she follows it up with distortion or chains. Chains can be easily dodged, or blocked, and distortion has an extremely low effective range. 
3) She is severely lacking in AOE. W and mimicked W are INSANELY risky to use offensively because she's just begging for cc if she does, and she's super squishy. 
4) Barely any CC to speak of. She can't ever lock someone down, her E is just way too unreliable to do the job in a team fight scenario.
5) She's extremely reliant on flanking. The only way you're going to blow up high priority targets is if you flank, which can only happen if you have vision control. Successful warding = unsuccessful leblanc. 

Leblanc can do 1 thing; blow up single targets. She can only do that job arguably better than any other assassin, and she has amazing tools to escape, but at the end of the day, there's clear counterplay available. She is killed by zone mages pretty darn hard, and her teamfight damage cannot rival that of other aoe champs (Viktor, Azir, Anivia, etc). Leblanc is all about outplaying your opponent. It feels frustrating when the LB you're up against is good, but ultimitely, if you know how to play around her better than she can play around you, you'll come out ahead. Just learn her power spikes, position properly, and don't go all in for the kill on her unless you have some NASTY good cc/damage or else she blew her W on something stupid and then used a different spell, or else had previously used her ult. Just remember that if LB doesn't kill you in her initial burst, she's out of damage, so kill her instead.

BTW, if someone says "(insert champion) has counter play.  Build (insert stat or item)." or "Just play smart.", this is my answer:
That is not counter play.  Regardless of whether or not a champ has counter play, you should play smart and buy items that help you to fight them.
To prove my point, lets compare {{champion:1}} and {{champion:61}}.  Both are fairly similar, having powerful ults, Armor and MR bonuses on their E's, and can both be played as supports (though Annie has very little CC and no way to shield, heal, or buff her ADC).

{{champion:1}} You cannot dodge any of Annie's spells, and even if her W can be dodged and I just do not know that it can, you can't dodge it when you are stunned by her point and click Q or her instant cast R.  There is also no way to stop her from gaining E's bonuses when she uses it.

{{champion:61}}  You can dodge Q, and you can stay away from the ball to dodge W and R.  As for her E, you can dodge the ball when it goes to her target (it deals damage when it is on its way to shield someone) and can attack Orianna when the ball is not on her, since she will not have the bonus Armor and MR then.
